thread.title: Phil Jackson turns his preaching toward Army football team
thread.title_full: Phil Jackson turns his preaching toward Army football team | New York Post

author: Marc Berman
title: Phil Jackson turns his preaching toward Army football team
text:
Knicks team president Phil Jackson gave a 15-minute pep talk — to the Army football team.
According to sources, Jackson spoke on Wednesday night for about 15 minutes inside Army football’s training facility to rev up the Black Knights, who play their season’s second-biggest game Saturday at Penn State. While Navy is its biggest contest, Saturday’s meeting before 105,000 in Happy Valley is Army’s first there since 1979.
Jackson spoke about building a culture and winning mentality. With legend Willis Reed by his side, Jackson also invoked the championship Knicks teams of the 1970s. Jackson spoke of the squad’s unmatched teamwork — a principle of cadet life.
A program that’s fallen on hard times, Army is 1-3 but coming off a surprising 58-36 rout of Eastern Michigan.
The Knicks players have witnessed various cadets drills, including their famous water workouts. On Tuesday, the players went to the Olympic pool as cadets dressed in full battle gear, including their rifles and boots, jumped off a diving board and swam laps.
